intro: Aciotis ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, yellowish-green foliage. The plant produces small, dandelion-like yellow flowers that are followed by fluffy, white seed heads. It thrives in moist, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks. Aciotis ferruginea is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
